SEARCH
Package Utils

Class InputUtils

java.lang.Object
Utils.InputUtils
public class InputUtils extends Object
Utility class for handling user input and input validation. This class provides reusable methods for reading and validating input like dates and transaction types.

  • Method Summary

  • Method Details

    • readType

      public static TransactionType readType(Scanner scanner)
      Prompts the user to choose a transaction type (Income or Expense) and validates the input. Keeps prompting until a valid choice is entered.
      Parameters:
      scanner - the Scanner object used for reading user input
      Returns:
      the selected TransactionType

    • readDate

      public static LocalDateTime readDate(Scanner scanner, String msg)
      Reads a date from user input and returns it as a LocalDateTime. Accepts either full datetime format yyyy-MM-dd HH:mm or date-only format yyyy-MM-dd. If only a date is provided, time defaults to start of day.
      Parameters:
      scanner - the Scanner object used for reading input
      msg - the prompt message to show the user
      Returns:
      the parsed LocalDateTime

    • readDate

      public static LocalDateTime readDate(Scanner scanner, String msg, boolean isWholeDay)
      Reads a date (with optional time) from the user and converts it into LocalDateTime. If only the date is provided and isWholeDay is true, the time is set to 23:59. Otherwise, it defaults to the start of the day (00:00).
      Parameters:
      scanner - the Scanner object used for reading input
      msg - the prompt message to show the user
      isWholeDay - if true and input is date-only, sets time to end of day (23:59), otherwise to start of day
      Returns:
      the parsed LocalDateTime

    • repeatUntilNotNull

      public static <T> T repeatUntilNotNull(Supplier<T> inputSupplier)
      Repeatedly executes the given Supplier until it returns a non-null result.

      This method is useful for validating user input or retrying operations until a valid value is obtained.

      Type Parameters:
      T - the type of the result
      Parameters:
      inputSupplier - the supplier function that provides a value of type T; it should return null when the input is invalid
      Returns:
      the first non-null result returned by the supplier
